meanings.definition: To surpass in figuring out or understanding something.
meanings.sent1: She outfigured her classmates in solving the math problem.
meanings.sent2: He always outfigures his opponents in chess.
meanings.sent3: The detective outfigured the criminal's plan and caught him red-handed.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition outfigured any logical reasoning.
meanings.sent5: The scientist outfigured the mystery of the universe with a groundbreaking theory.

meanings.definition: To calculate or estimate something to be greater than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: He outfigured the cost of the project, leading to budget issues.
meanings.sent2: She tends to outfigure the time it takes to complete tasks.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast outfigured the actual rainfall, causing surprise.
meanings.sent4: His excitement outfigured the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The magician outfigured the audience's expectations with a spectacular trick.
